skill.name: xlsx
skill.description: Comprehensive spreadsheet creation, editing, and analysis with support for formulas, formatting, data analysis, and visualization. When Claude needs to work with spreadsheets (.xlsx, .xlsm, .csv, .tsv, etc) for: (1) Creating new spreadsheets with formulas and formatting, (2) Reading or analyzing data, (3) Modify existing spreadsheets while preserving formulas, (4) Data analysis and visualization in spreadsheets, or (5) Recalculating formulas

security_audit.summary: Official skill from Anthropic with minimal audit required. No security issues were identified in the scanned files.

content.value_statement: You need reliable spreadsheets with correct formulas and formatting. This skill creates, edits, and recalculates workbooks with clear error checks.
actual_capabilities: Create and edit XLSX files with formulas and formatting guidance
Read and analyze spreadsheets using pandas workflows
Recalculate formulas via LibreOffice headless using recalc.py
Scan all cells for Excel error codes and report locations
Count formulas across all sheets in a workbook
limitations: Requires LibreOffice and soffice available for recalculation
Recalculation focuses on XLSX workbooks handled by openpyxl
Error detection only checks standard Excel error strings in values
Primary support targets Linux and macOS environments

use_cases.title: Model refresh checks
use_cases.description: Update a financial model, recalc formulas, and verify zero Excel errors.

use_cases.title: Weekly report update
use_cases.description: Edit a template workbook, preserve formatting, and regenerate totals.

use_cases.title: Data import review
use_cases.description: Load a workbook with pandas, summarize data, and export clean XLSX.

prompt_templates.title: Create simple sheet
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new XLSX with a header row and a SUM formula for column totals. Save as sales_summary.xlsx.

prompt_templates.title: Edit existing file
prompt_templates.prompt: Open report.xlsx, insert a new column for Margin, add formula, and preserve existing formatting.

prompt_templates.title: Recalculate and validate
prompt_templates.prompt: Run formula recalculation on output.xlsx and report any Excel errors and locations.

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Load data.xlsx with pandas, create a formatted sheet with formulas, save to result.xlsx, then recalc and summarize formula errors.

output_examples.input: Recalculate quarterly_model.xlsx and tell me if there are any formula errors
output: No Excel error codes were found in any sheet

best_practices: Use formulas in Excel cells instead of hardcoding computed values
Run recalc.py after any formula changes to validate results
Preserve template formatting when editing existing workbooks
anti_patterns: Hardcoding totals computed in Python into cells
Saving with data_only and losing formulas
Skipping recalculation when formulas were added

faq.question: Which file types are supported?
faq.answer: Primary support is for XLSX files. CSV and TSV are for data import workflows.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: LibreOffice must be installed, and recalculation targets openpyxl compatible files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with pandas workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes patterns for reading, analyzing, and writing with pandas.

faq.question: Is my data stored or sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. Processing is local and uses local files only.

faq.question: What if recalculation fails?
faq.answer: Check LibreOffice installation, macro setup, and rerun with a longer timeout.

faq.question: How does it compare to pure Excel editing?
faq.answer: It automates edits and validation while keeping formulas in the workbook.
